explanation: Not correct. MISRA R8.13 asks that pointers point to const-qualified types when that can be done without changing the program semantics. In this function the local variable entry is used as the value returned from the function (the function returns struct UserEntry *). Declaring the local as const struct UserEntry *entry would be inconsistent with the function’s non-const return type (and would either force a const cast on return or require changing the API). Because the pointer must be returned as a non-const pointer, it is not possible here to make the local pointer const without changing the function’s interface/semantics, so the rule does not necessarily require a change in this translation unit. (Separately, if the user_ids and their userhash_* arrays are in fact immutable, the correct fix would be to make those objects const and, if appropriate, change the API to return const struct UserEntry * — but that is a design/API change, not the simple local-pointer const qualification that Agent A suggested.)
